content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Find 5 beauty salons with ratings greater than 4.8 in Seattle, WA.  Please interact with https://www.google.com/maps/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: To find beauty salons in Seattle, WA with ratings greater than 4.8, I should first search for "beauty salons in Seattle, WA" using the search bar.
Action: Type [0]; beauty salons in Seattle, WA
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.1
token: : Type [0]; beauty salons in Seattle, WA

content: Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The list of beauty salons in Seattle, WA is visible, but none with ratings above 4.8 appear in the initial results. To filter salons with ratings greater than 4.8, I should use the rating filter option.
Action: Click [4]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The visible rating filter options only go up to 4.5, but the task requires beauty salons with ratings greater than 4.8. I need to see if further filtering or another sorting/search method is possible (maybe with "All filters") or check salons manually.
Action: Click [13] (All filters) to see if more granular rating options are available.
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.2
token: : Click [13] (All filters) to see if more granular rating options are available

content: Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The filter options under "All filters" only allow for "Any rating" or a simple minimum rating, not custom or 4.8+ minimums. I should check the options under the "Any rating" dropdown (label [7]) to see if a higher rating can be set.
Action: Click [7]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.25
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The maximum filter available is "4.5" for ratings, but there is no direct option for filtering 4.8 or above. The next best step is to apply the "4.5" filter to narrow down the list, and then manually check for salons rated greater than 4.8.
Action: Click [6] (4.5 stars)
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The 4.5+ star filter is now applied. To see the filtered results and check individual ratings (looking for those above 4.8), I need to confirm and exit the filter pane.
Action: Click [6] (Done)
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.35
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The filtered results are now displayed, but the currently visible salons all have ratings of 4.7, which is not sufficient. I need to scroll down the list to check for salons rated higher, specifically greater than 4.8.
Action: Scroll [13]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.4
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Only one salon so far ("Beehive Salon West Seattle") meets the ratings > 4.8 criteria with a 4.8 rating. More results need to be scanned to find 5 salons with greater than 4.8.
Action: Scroll [12]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.45
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I now see a salon with a 5.0 rating (Lady Neptune Hair Salon, Seattle), which matches the criteria. Currently, two salons have ratings ≥ 4.8: Beehive Salon West Seattle (4.8) and Lady Neptune Hair Salon, Seattle (5.0). I still need to find 3 more salons. I should continue scrolling.
Action: Scroll [14]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.55
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Two more salons fulfill the criteria: "Vann Studio Salon" (4.8) and "Industry Salon" (4.8). Now I have four salons with ratings ≥ 4.8, but I need one more to complete the list. I should continue scrolling for additional results.
Action: Scroll [14]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.8
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The currently visible entries have already been reviewed, and we already have four salons rated ≥ 4.8. Since we need one more, I should continue to scroll down to load and check more salon options.
Action: Scroll [14]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.8
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The list of salons has not updated, and the visible ones (Beehive Salon, Vann Studio Salon, Industry Salon) are already checked. I need to load more results, which may require moving to the next page.
Action: Click [6] (Next page)
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.85
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The salons shown (Vann Studio Salon, Industry Salon, Beehive Salon) are already reviewed and do not add a new entry with a rating greater than 4.8. To continue searching, I should scroll down the list of results.
Action: Scroll [16]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.85
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The visible salons are the same as before and the scroll bar indicates there is still more to see in the list. Scrolling further down will likely reveal more salons and may help to find one more with a rating above 4.8.
Action: Scroll [16]; down
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.85
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: No new salons are visible yet but the scrollbar suggests there are more results below. Scrolling further may reveal more salons potentially rated above 4.8.
Action: Scroll [16]; down
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.87
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The same three salons are still visible, and the scroll bar indicates progress but more results may still be below the current view. Continued scrolling is needed to reveal new salons, increasing the chances of finding another rated >4.8.
Action: Scroll [16]; down
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.87
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I can see a small portion of "Beehive Salon" at the bottom of the list. It is necessary to scroll down again to fully view its rating, and potentially more salons that might meet the criteria.
Action: Scroll [16]; down
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.9

Observation: please analyze the attached screenshot and give the Thought and Action. I've provided the tag name of each element and the text it contains (if text exists). Note that <textarea> or <input> may be textbox, but not exactly. Please focus more on the screenshot and then refer to the textual information.

content:
Thought: The visible part of "Beehive Salon" does not show its full rating. I need to scroll further so the rating of Beehive Salon (and potentially more salons) becomes fully visible and allows me to check for a rating greater than 4.8.
Action: Scroll [16]; down
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.9
